metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10729 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Amanda 3.3.1. A user with backup privileges can trivially compromise a client installation. The "runtar" setuid root binary does not check for additional arguments supplied after --create, allowing users to manipulate commands and perform command injection as root.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

amanda-client - 1:3.5.1-1build2
amanda-common - 1:3.5.1-1build2
amanda-server - 1:3.5.1-1build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: amanda package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.5.1-1build2').
